# todo-rank

> Scan TODOs. Rank what matters now.

todo-rank is a CLI tool that scans codebases for TODO/FIXME/@next comments and ranks them by priority score.

## Installation

```bash
go install github.com/simulacre7/todo-rank/cmd/todo-rank@latest
```

Ensure `$HOME/go/bin` is in your PATH.

## Quick Usage

```bash
# Scan current directory
todo-rank

# Show only high priority (P0, P1)
todo-rank --min-score 80

# Output as markdown
todo-rank --format md --out TODOs.md

# Scan specific directory
todo-rank --root ./src

# Exclude directories
todo-rank --ignore .git,node_modules,dist,vendor
```

## Options

- `--root <path>` : Directory to scan (default: .)
- `--ignore <csv>` : Directories to ignore (default: .git,node_modules,dist)
- `--format <text|md>` : Output format (default: text)
- `--out <path>` : Output file (default: stdout)
- `--min-score <n>` : Minimum score filter (default: 0)
- `--tags <csv>` : Tags to scan (default: TODO,FIXME,@next)

## Scoring System

Tags: FIXME (+100), TODO (+50), @next (+30)
Priority: [P0] (+100), [P1] (+70), [P2] (+40), [P3] (+10)
Path bonus: cmd/ or main.go (+20)
Test penalty: *_test.* (-20)

Levels: P0 (>=120), P1 (>=80), P2 (>=40), P3 (<40)

## Supported Comment Formats

```
// TODO: message
// TODO[P1]: message with priority
// FIXME[P0]: urgent fix
// @next: upcoming task
# TODO: python style
/* TODO: block comment */
```

## When to Use

- Before starting a coding session: `todo-rank --min-score 80`
- Generate actionable task list: `todo-rank --format md --out TODOs.md`
- Focus on critical paths: `todo-rank --root ./cmd --min-score 120`
- Review technical debt: `todo-rank --min-score 0`
